intro: Santiria dacryodifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed santiria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Santiria dacryodifolia is valued for its traditional use in herbal medicine for treating various ailments.
